August 25, 1958.
^*oj5ert E. Underwood, Ja*
Network Manager,
NASB,
Urbana, Illinois.
Dear Mr* Underwood:
■%
^ V
Thanks so much for the quick response to ray letter
^d the material you sent me. I have forwarded most of the material
by air mail to Mr, Rolf Zetterlund, the President of our company, at
Orebro, Sweden for his examination and consideration, I feel certain
that he will have an immediate favorable reaction. I am enclosing
some printed material which I have been giving to interested parties*
I am sorry that I do not have any extra copies of the list of tape
recordings. Apparently the lists sinc^e May have been lost in the
mails. As soon as they arrive, I will send you copies for your con¬
sideration^ I have also sent a photo copy of your letter for con-
sideratioB by Mr. Zetterlund. He plans to come to the U.S.A again
this fall. I met him two years ago this fall and he was here last
November on a two week^s trip to this countyy, I hope he will be
able to come to Urbana to see you this year,
^ present time I have made program exchanges
with KTOK in Oklahoma City, KVOO in Tulsa, KTRH-PM in Houston, and
the University of Wisconsin State Network through cliff fiblen, who
you may know. If Cliff is in Madison this Friday, I hope to visit
with him on a short trip that my wife and I arkm. taking to visit ray
'^if®*s mother. I wish I had time to visit Urbana to see you, but I 7"^^
will have to make it some® other time.
I wish you could sen<l me another set of mater’ial
by parcel post for my own file as I forwarded most of the material
to Rolf Zetterlund in Sweden, He has been doing a lot of contract work
on tapes for RCA in Oslo, Norway and for Livingston and Oraegatapes,
commercial pre-recorded tape companies in this country*
T have four programs by Egon Kjerrman's orchestr
-a that I can send you anytime for your use in dubbing or copying
them. Cliff Eblen has two programs he should be copying aid I will
take him two more on my trip to Madison*
We have a lot of Illj^ols alumni here in the
city, I am President of the ‘''Wisconsin Alumni here and Norman where
we have about I30 alumni in the two cities.
Sincerely yours,
E,G* Dahlgren.
